text: Adam fell that men might be; and men are, that they might have joy.
Wherefore, ye must press forward with a steadfastness in Christ, having a perfect brightness of hope, and a love of God and of all men.
When ye are in the service of your fellow beings ye are only in the service of your God.
To mourn with those that mourn; yea, and comfort those that stand in need of comfort.
By small and simple things are great things brought to pass.
O, remember, my son, and learn wisdom in thy youth; yea, learn in thy youth to keep the commandments of God.
It is upon the rock of our Redeemer, who is Christ, the Son of God, that ye must build your foundation.
If men come unto me I will show unto them their weakness.
Ask God, the Eternal Father, in the name of Christ, if these things are not true.
Look unto me in every thought; doubt not, fear not.
Pray always, that you may come off conqueror.
Remember the worth of souls is great in the sight of God.
Learn of me, and listen to my words; walk in the meekness of my Spirit.
Men should be anxiously engaged in a good cause, and do many things of their own free will.
Seek learning, even by study and also by faith.
For behold, this is my work and my gloryâ€”to bring to pass the immortality and eternal life of man.
Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the Lord thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest.
Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God.
Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
